qas.question: Which political practice did Montesquieu originate?
How many divisions of the government did Montesquieu call for?
What document was greatly informed by the idea of separation of powers?
What kind of oversight does the separation of powers help to promote?
What was the doctrine called that allowed the three branches of government to check the powers of each other?
What originates in the writings of the Legislative powers?
Who urged for a government with four individual branches?
In which doctrine did the US call for three separate branches of government?
Which philosophy was a great influence on the Legislative branch of government?
Which document was greatly influenced by the idea of a constitutional government?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Separation of powers<b5_0/><a0_0/> is a political doctrine originating in the writings of <b6_0>Montesquieu<b6_0/> in <b7_0>The Spirit of the Laws<b7_0/> where he urged for a constitutional government with <a1_0>three<a1_0/> separate branches of government. Each of the three branches would have defined abilities to check the powers of the other branches. This idea was called <a4_0><b8_0>separation of powers<b8_0/><a4_0/>. This philosophy heavily influenced the writing of the <a2_0><b9_0>United States Constitution<b9_0/><a2_0/>, according to which the Legislative, Executive, and Judicial branches of the United States government are kept distinct in order to prevent abuse of power. This United States form of separation of powers is associated with a system of <a3_0>checks and balances<a3_0/>.
